ol.li: A mbrosia is a little shrub three feet in height, full of branches, with small leaves like rue around the emergent stalk.
It has small stems full of little seeds like little bunches of grapes, which never flower â€” smelling pleasant like wine.
The root is slender, two feet long.
In Cappadocia it is plaited into wreaths for the head.
It is able to repress and repel, and is smeared on as an astringent for fluids that have come down.
It is also called botrys, or botrys artemisi a, the Romans call it caper sylvaticus, or apium rusticum, and the Egyptians, merseo.
